title: Matthew Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 21.

questions.question: Where did Jesus send two disciples when they drew near unto Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Bethphage
questions.explanation: Jesus sent two disciples to Bethphage as they drew near unto Jerusalem (Matthew 21:1).

questions.question: What were the disciples instructed to find and bring to Jesus in the village?
questions.correctAnswer: An ass and a colt
questions.explanation: Jesus told his disciples to find an ass tied and a colt with her and bring them to Him (Matthew 21:2).

questions.question: What were the disciples to say if anyone questioned them about taking the ass and colt?
options: The Lord hath need of them
We are borrowing them for a day
They are free for the taking
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord hath need of them
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed the disciples to say, 'The Lord hath need of them' if questioned (Matthew 21:3).

questions.question: According to the prophecy cited, how does the King come to the daughter of Sion?
options: Meek and sitting upon an ass and a colt
questions.correctAnswer: Meek and sitting upon an ass and a colt
questions.explanation: The prophecy says the King comes meek and sitting upon an ass and a colt (Matthew 21:5).

questions.question: What did the multitude do as Jesus rode into Jerusalem?
options: Spread their garments and cut branches from trees
questions.correctAnswer: Spread their garments and cut branches from trees
questions.explanation: The crowd spread their garments and cut down branches from trees to lay in the way (Matthew 21:8).

questions.question: What did the people cry out as Jesus entered Jerusalem?
options: Hosanna to the Son of David
questions.correctAnswer: Hosanna to the Son of David
questions.explanation: The multitudes cried, 'Hosanna to the Son of David' as Jesus entered Jerusalem (Matthew 21:9).

questions.question: What did Jesus do when He went into the temple of God?
options: Cast out those who sold and bought and overthrew tables
questions.correctAnswer: Cast out those who sold and bought and overthrew tables
questions.explanation: Jesus cast out those that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers (Matthew 21:12).

questions.question: What did Jesus say the temple should be called?
questions.correctAnswer: The house of prayer
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'My house shall be called the house of prayer' (Matthew 21:13).

questions.question: Who came to Jesus in the temple and were healed?
questions.correctAnswer: The blind and the lame
questions.explanation: Blind and lame people came to Jesus in the temple and He healed them (Matthew 21:14).

questions.question: How did the chief priests and scribes feel when children cried 'Hosanna to the Son of David'?
questions.correctAnswer: Sore displeased
questions.explanation: The chief priests and scribes were sore displeased when they heard the children crying (Matthew 21:15).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that out of the mouth of babes and sucklings praise has been perfected.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus confirmed that praise is perfected out of the mouth of babes and sucklings (Matthew 21:16).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus lodged in Bethany after leaving the city.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus left the city and lodged in Bethany (Matthew 21:17).

questions.question: What happened to the fig tree when Jesus found no fruit on it?
options: The fig tree bore fruit immediately
questions.correctAnswer: The fig tree withered away
questions.explanation: Jesus cursed the fig tree and it withered away because it had leaves but no fruit (Matthew 21:19-20).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Verily I say unto you, If ye have ______, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree.'
questions.correctAnswer: faith
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that if ye have faith and doubt not, great things can be done (Matthew 21:21).

questions.question: What question did Jesus ask the chief priests and elders about John's baptism?
options: Was it from heaven or of men?
Was it done in the temple or outside?
Was it accepted by the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Was it from heaven or of men?
questions.explanation: Jesus asked if John's baptism was from heaven or from men, causing them to reason among themselves (Matthew 21:25).

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt in prayer. Based on Matthew 21, what biblical truth would you share about faith and prayer?
options: Faith and doubt affect the outcome of prayer; believe to receive
Prayer is only effective if done publicly
Doubt is necessary to keep prayers realistic
Prayer should be repeated many times for effectiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Faith and doubt affect the outcome of prayer; believe to receive
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:21-22 teaches that if one has faith and doubts not, they can move mountains and receive what they ask in prayer. This highlights the importance of confident faith in prayer.

questions.question: How does Matthew 21 demonstrate the importance of obedience in daily work and service?
options: Obedience to God's commands is shown by doing the work He asks even after initial refusal
Only those who eagerly say yes are truly obedient
Work should be avoided if it is difficult
Obedience depends on personal feelings at the moment
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commands is shown by doing the work He asks even after initial refusal
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:28-30, the first son initially refuses but later obeys, showing that true obedience may involve repentance and action rather than just words.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and praise can we learn from Jesus' response to the chief priests and scribes regarding the children in the temple?
options: Praise from humble and innocent sources is perfected by God
Only adults can offer true praise
Praise must be loud and public to be valid
questions.correctAnswer: Praise from humble and innocent sources is perfected by God
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:15-16 shows Jesus quoting scripture to affirm that praise from 'babes and sucklings' is perfected by God, teaching humility and the value of sincere praise.

questions.question: How does the cleansing of the temple in Matthew 21 teach us about integrity and reverence in our service to God?
options: God's house must be a place of prayer, not corruption or exploitation
It is acceptable to mix business with worship
Integrity is less important than ritual observance
questions.correctAnswer: God's house must be a place of prayer, not corruption or exploitation
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:12-13, Jesus clears out the moneychangers and sellers, emphasizing that the temple should be a holy place focused on prayer and not a den of thieves, highlighting integrity in worship.

questions.question: A believer is hesitant to share the gospel because of fear of others’ opinions. What truth from Matthew 21 encourages boldness in witnessing?
options: Those who repent and believe, even if considered sinners, enter God’s kingdom before the self-righteous
Only the religious elite are qualified to witness
Fear of people is a sign to stop sharing
questions.correctAnswer: Those who repent and believe, even if considered sinners, enter God’s kingdom before the self-righteous
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:31-32 teaches that publicans and harlots who believed John the Baptist entered the kingdom before the religious leaders, encouraging boldness regardless of social status.

questions.question: According to Matthew 21, how should we respond spiritually when we encounter unfruitfulness in our lives or ministry?
options: Exercise faith and expect God to bring change and fruitfulness
Ignore the problem and hope it improves
Blame others for lack of fruit
Give up and move on to something else
questions.correctAnswer: Exercise faith and expect God to bring change and fruitfulness
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:18-22 shows Jesus cursing the fruitless fig tree and teaching that faith can cause even mountains to move, symbolizing the power of faith to overcome spiritual barrenness.

questions.question: What does the parable of the wicked husbandmen in Matthew 21 teach about stewardship and accountability?
options: God expects faithful stewardship and will hold people accountable for rejecting His messengers
Those who reject God’s servants have no consequences
Stewardship only applies to church leaders
questions.correctAnswer: God expects faithful stewardship and will hold people accountable for rejecting His messengers
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:33-41 describes the wicked husbandmen who mistreated the servants and son sent by the owner, illustrating that God holds people accountable for rejecting His messengers and stewardship.

questions.question: How does Matthew 21 instruct believers to approach spiritual authority and discernment?
options: We should test and discern authority, as Jesus did with the chief priests and elders
Authority must always be accepted without question
Authority is irrelevant in spiritual matters
Discerning authority is only for pastors
questions.correctAnswer: We should test and discern authority, as Jesus did with the chief priests and elders
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:23-27 records Jesus questioning the chief priests about John’s baptism, showing the importance of discerning the source and legitimacy of spiritual authority.

questions.question: What practical teaching about prayer and trust can a believer draw from Jesus’ promise in Matthew 21?
options: Pray with faith and believe to receive what you ask
Prayers must be long and repetitive
God only answers prayers made in church
questions.correctAnswer: Pray with faith and believe to receive what you ask
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:22 emphasizes that whatever is asked in prayer, believing, will be received, teaching believers to trust God wholeheartedly in prayer.

questions.question: True or False: The people welcomed Jesus into Jerusalem with praise and proclaimed Him as the Son of David, showing the importance of worshiping Christ openly.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:8-9 records the crowd spreading garments and branches, shouting 'Hosanna to the Son of David,' demonstrating open worship and acknowledgment of Jesus as Messiah.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus condemned the temple merchants for turning God's house into a marketplace, emphasizing reverence in worship spaces.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:12-13, Jesus drove out the merchants and moneychangers, declaring the temple a house of prayer, not a den of thieves, teaching reverence and integrity in worship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the ____________.'
questions.correctAnswer: head of the corner
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:42 quotes scripture to show Jesus as the rejected stone that becomes the head of the corner, symbolizing His essential role in God’s kingdom.

questions.question: Based on Matthew 21, how should a believer respond when faced with hypocrisy in religious leaders?
options: Recognize it and remain faithful to God’s truth
Join in hypocrisy to fit in
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize it and remain faithful to God’s truth
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:45-46 shows that the chief priests and Pharisees were exposed by Jesus’ parables, teaching believers to discern hypocrisy and stay true to God’s word.

questions.question: What does Matthew 21 teach about the connection between repentance and entering the kingdom of God?
options: Repentance leads to belief and entrance into God’s kingdom
Repentance is unnecessary if you are religious
Only good works matter, not repentance
Repentance is only for sinners outside the church
questions.correctAnswer: Repentance leads to belief and entrance into God’s kingdom
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:31-32 shows that those who repented and believed John the Baptist’s message were accepted into the kingdom, teaching the vital role of repentance.

questions.question: How does the parable of the two sons in Matthew 21 challenge believers in their daily walk with God?
options: Actions speak louder than words; obedience is what counts
Saying yes is enough without action
God prefers those who never hesitate
questions.correctAnswer: Actions speak louder than words; obedience is what counts
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:28-31 contrasts the son who said no but obeyed later with the one who said yes but did not go, highlighting the importance of actual obedience.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 21.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus riding on an ass and a colt as he approached Jerusalem, according to Matthew 21?
options: It fulfilled the prophecy of Zechariah about the coming King
It was a common method of travel for rabbis
It demonstrated Jesus' wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfilled the prophecy of Zechariah about the coming King
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:4-5 cites the prophecy, 'Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass,' showing Jesus' deliberate fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy (Zechariah 9:9).

questions.question: In Matthew 21, what did the multitudes cry out as Jesus entered Jerusalem?
options: Hosanna to the Son of David
Glory to God in the highest
Blessed is the King of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Hosanna to the Son of David
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:9 records the crowds shouting, 'Hosanna to the Son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest,' which is an acknowledgment of Jesus as the Messiah.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond to the chief priests and elders when asked by what authority He acted in the temple?
options: He asked them about the origin of John the Baptist's baptism
He immediately declared His divine authority
He refused to answer them directly
He quoted the Law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: He asked them about the origin of John the Baptist's baptism
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:24-25 shows Jesus answering their question with a question about John's baptism, testing their response to expose their unwillingness to acknowledge divine authority.

questions.question: What lesson about obedience is conveyed through the parable of the two sons in Matthew 21?
options: Both sons obeyed their father equally
questions.correctAnswer: Actions speak louder than words
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:28-31 contrasts the son who initially refuses but later obeys with the one who agrees but does not act, illustrating that true obedience is demonstrated by actions, not mere words.

questions.question: In the parable of the wicked husbandmen, what does the vineyard typically symbolize in Old Testament imagery?
questions.correctAnswer: The nation of Israel
questions.explanation: The imagery of a vineyard as a symbol for Israel is well established in Old Testament texts such as Isaiah 5:1-7, and Matthew 21:33-41 uses this to illustrate Israel's rejection of God's messengers and Son.

questions.question: What Old Testament scripture does Jesus cite in Matthew 21 to describe Himself as the rejected stone becoming the cornerstone?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 118:22
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:42 quotes Psalm 118:22, describing the stone rejected by the builders becoming the cornerstone, symbolizing Jesus' rejection by the religious leaders yet elevation by God.

questions.question: According to Matthew 21, what will happen to those who fall on the stone Jesus mentions?
questions.correctAnswer: They will be broken
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:44 states, 'And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken,' implying judgment upon those who reject Christ, whereas those upon whom the stone falls will be crushed, symbolizing divine judgment.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying, 'If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree...'?
options: Faith enables believers to perform miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Faith enables believers to perform miracles
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:21, Jesus teaches that unwavering faith can lead to miraculous outcomes, using the withering fig tree as an example of divine power accessible through faith.

questions.question: Why did Jesus clear the temple, according to Matthew 21?
options: Because it had become a den of thieves instead of a house of prayer
Because the priests asked Him to
Because it was a festival day
questions.correctAnswer: Because it had become a den of thieves instead of a house of prayer
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:12-13 records Jesus driving out the moneychangers and merchants, declaring that 'My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves,' indicating His concern for temple purity and worship.

questions.question: True or False: The chief priests and Pharisees attempted to seize Jesus immediately after hearing His parables in Matthew 21.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:46 explains that although the chief priests and Pharisees wanted to arrest Jesus after His parables, they feared the crowd who regarded Him as a prophet, so they refrained.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the city of Jerusalem when Jesus entered, as recorded in Matthew 21?
options: The whole city was moved, asking 'Who is this?'
They immediately welcomed Him as King
questions.correctAnswer: The whole city was moved, asking 'Who is this?'
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:10 records that when Jesus entered Jerusalem, the city was stirred, and people asked, 'Who is this?' indicating curiosity and unrest about His identity.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond to the children's praise in the temple, according to Matthew 21?
options: He affirmed that praise comes from the mouth of babes and sucklings
He rebuked them for making noise
He told them to be quiet
questions.correctAnswer: He affirmed that praise comes from the mouth of babes and sucklings
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:16 quotes Jesus acknowledging the praise from children, referencing scripture that God perfects praise from the mouths of the young, showing the value of pure worship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: receive
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:22 teaches that prayer coupled with faith results in receiving what is asked for, emphasizing the power of faith-filled prayer.

questions.question: What theme is highlighted by the contrast between the publicans and harlots and the chief priests in Matthew 21:31-32?
options: Repentance and acceptance of the kingdom of God
The role of the temple sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Repentance and acceptance of the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:31-32 shows that sinners who repented and believed John the Baptist entered God's kingdom before the self-righteous chief priests who did not repent, highlighting repentance as key.

questions.question: What cultural practice is demonstrated by the multitudes spreading garments and branches on the road as Jesus entered Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: A royal honorific procession
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:8 describes people spreading garments and branches, a common ancient Near Eastern practice to honor a king or important figure, symbolizing Jesus' acceptance as King.

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the significance of Jesus riding on an ass and a colt into Jerusalem, according to the fulfillment of prophecy?
options: It fulfilled the prophecy that the Messiah would come meek and humble
It showed Jesus' royal power by riding a war horse
It was a common practice for kings to ride horses into cities
It symbolized Jesus' rejection by the people
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfilled the prophecy that the Messiah would come meek and humble
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:4-5 shows Jesus riding an ass and colt to fulfill Zechariah 9:9, indicating the Messiah's humility and meekness. This contrasts earthly kings who rode horses, highlighting Christ's servant kingship.

questions.question: What did the multitudes shout as Jesus entered Jerusalem, declaring His messianic identity?
options: Hosanna to the Son of David
Glory to the King of Israel
Blessed is the Prophet from Nazareth
questions.correctAnswer: Hosanna to the Son of David
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:9 records the crowd shouting 'Hosanna to the Son of David,' recognizing Jesus as the promised Messiah from David's lineage, fulfilling messianic expectations (cf. Psalm 118:25-26; 2 Samuel 7:12-16).

questions.question: Why did Jesus cleanse the temple by driving out the moneychangers and sellers?
options: Because they had turned God's house into a den of thieves
Because He wanted to stop commerce in Jerusalem
Because they refused to pay the temple tax
Because they were selling poor quality goods
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had turned God's house into a den of thieves
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:12-13, Jesus declares the temple should be a house of prayer, but they made it a den of thieves, condemning the corruption and exploitation that profaned the sacred place (cf. Isaiah 56:7; Jeremiah 7:11).

questions.question: What characteristic did Jesus highlight as necessary to perform works like cursing the fig tree and moving mountains?
questions.correctAnswer: Faith without doubt
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:21 teaches that faith without doubt enables believers to perform miraculous works, emphasizing trust in God’s power (cf. Mark 11:22-24; James 1:6; Hebrews 11:6).

questions.question: What was Jesus’ response when the chief priests and elders questioned His authority?
options: He asked them about the origin of John the Baptist's baptism
He immediately declared His divine authority
He performed a miracle to prove His authority
questions.correctAnswer: He asked them about the origin of John the Baptist's baptism
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:23-27 records Jesus' strategic response, questioning their acceptance of John’s baptism to expose their inconsistency and unwillingness to acknowledge divine authority (cf. Luke 20:1-8).

questions.question: In the parable of the two sons, which son did the will of the father?
options: The first son who initially refused but later repented and went
The second son who agreed to go but did not
questions.correctAnswer: The first son who initially refused but later repented and went
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:28-31 shows the first son obeyed ultimately, illustrating that repentance and obedience are more important than mere words, a principle consistent with James 2:17 and Isaiah 1:19.

questions.question: According to Jesus, who would enter the kingdom of God before the religious leaders?
questions.correctAnswer: Publicans and harlots
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:31-32 teaches that sinners like publicans and harlots, who believed John’s message and repented, would enter God’s kingdom before the unrepentant religious leaders, highlighting God’s grace (cf. Luke 7:36-50).

questions.question: In the parable of the vineyard, what did the wicked husbandmen do to the servants and the son sent by the owner?
options: Beat the servants and killed the son
questions.correctAnswer: Beat the servants and killed the son
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:33-39 describes the husbandmen mistreating and killing the owner's servants and son, symbolizing Israel’s rejection of the prophets and ultimately Jesus, the Son of God (cf. Psalm 118:22; Isaiah 53:3-7).

questions.question: What is the meaning of the 'stone which the builders rejected' in Jesus’ teaching?
options: Jesus as the cornerstone of God's kingdom
A literal stone in the temple
A symbol of the Roman Empire
A rejected teaching of the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus as the cornerstone of God's kingdom
questions.explanation: In Matthew 21:42, Jesus refers to Psalm 118:22, identifying Himself as the rejected stone that becomes the chief cornerstone of God's redemptive plan, foundational to the church (cf. Ephesians 2:20; 1 Peter 2:7).

questions.question: What consequence did Jesus say would happen to those upon whom the stone falls?
options: They will be broken or ground to powder
questions.correctAnswer: They will be broken or ground to powder
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:44 teaches that those who reject Christ will face judgment and destruction, consistent with biblical themes of God’s righteous judgment (cf. Isaiah 8:14; Romans 9:33; 1 Peter 2:8).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the chief priests and Pharisees after hearing Jesus’ parables?
options: They perceived He was speaking about them
questions.correctAnswer: They perceived He was speaking about them
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:45 shows the religious leaders recognized Jesus’ parables were indictments of their own rebellion and sin, fulfilling prophetic warnings (cf. Jeremiah 23:29; Ezekiel 33:33).

questions.question: What kept the chief priests from arresting Jesus despite their desire to do so?
options: They feared the multitude who regarded Him as a prophet
They were waiting for the right moment
They were convinced by His teaching
questions.correctAnswer: They feared the multitude who regarded Him as a prophet
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:46 explains the religious leaders’ hesitation to seize Jesus because of the people’s perception of Him as a prophet, indicating His popular support and divine endorsement (cf. John 11:47-48).

questions.question: How did Jesus demonstrate His authority and identity at the temple besides teaching?
options: By cleansing the temple and healing the blind and lame
By writing on the temple walls
By calling down fire from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: By cleansing the temple and healing the blind and lame
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:12-14 shows Jesus cleansing the temple and healing, confirming His messianic authority and fulfilling Isaiah 35:5-6 about the coming Messiah's miracles and restoration.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ cursing of the fruitless fig tree symbolize in the context of this chapter?
options: A natural event with no symbolic meaning
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment on unfruitfulness and hypocrisy
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:18-19 uses the fig tree as a symbol of Israel's spiritual barrenness, illustrating divine judgment on those who appear outwardly religious but bear no fruit, consistent with Jeremiah 8:13 and Hosea 9:10.

questions.question: What assurance does Jesus give about prayer in this chapter?
options: Whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive
Prayer is unnecessary because God’s will is fixed
questions.correctAnswer: Whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive
questions.explanation: Matthew 21:22 promises that prayer offered with faith will be answered, affirming God’s responsiveness to believers’ requests (cf. Mark 11:24; John 14:13-14; James 5:16).
